name: Salome at Schaubühne
description: Michael Thalheimer's highly anticipated staging of Oscar Wilde's 'Salome' in Einar Schleef's adaptation opens at Schaubühne. Thalheimer describes the demands of the role as a 'Zumutung' (imposition), while praising Anna Stiegler's performance as 'höchste Kunst' (highest art). This production marks a significant theatrical event, bringing a fresh perspective to one of theater's most challenging roles.
